 [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎חֲשַׁל‎</span>] **verb** ==shatter== by a blow (Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***—ašâlu***</u></abbr>, ***shatter***, perhaps ***thresh***; Late Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎חָשַׁל‎</span> Pi\`el ***shatter:*** Jewish-Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎חֲשַׁל‎</span> ***forge, hammer***, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***forge, furbish***; [[BDB#Buhl|Buhl]]<sup>14</sup> compare [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎חוּשְׁלָא‎</span> ***barkley-groats*** (as ***pounded, beaten***), and perhaps Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***—ûlu***</u></abbr>, ***barley***; [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>M 135</sup> compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***thrust, drive away*** ([[BDB#Frey|Frey]]), [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎נַחְשׁוֺל‎</span> ***storm (y sea***; compare in English ***beaten, buffetted*** by waves; Assyrian loan-word [[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>ZA ii. 117</sup>), Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***); — 

**Pe\`al** ***Participle active*** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎חָשֵׁל‎</span> [[Dan.2.40|Dan 2:40]] (accusative of thing).
